channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration illegally froze billions in Harvard funds, judge rules
item.description: The ruling is a legal victory for Harvard but the White House says it will appeal the decision.
item.content:encoded:
The ruling is a legal victory for Harvard but the White House says it will appeal the decision.

(Image credit: Elissa Nadworny)
item.dc:creator: Sequoia Carrillo

item.title: A spine-tingling discovery: This dinosaur had spiked body armor
item.description: In a new paper, researchers describe a bizarre dinosaur with thorny spines along its neck and back that made its home in Africa more than 165 million years ago.
item.content:encoded:
In a new paper, researchers describe a bizarre dinosaur with thorny spines along its neck and back that made its home in Africa more than 165 million years ago.

(Image credit: Matt Dempsey)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: How Trump's latest crypto launch enriches his family
item.description: The president and his sons made $5 billion on paper as their cryptocurrency started trading — highlighting the extraordinary degree to which they are personally profiting from Trump's return to the Oval Office.
item.content:encoded:
The president and his sons made $5 billion on paper as their cryptocurrency started trading — highlighting the extraordinary degree to which they are personally profiting from Trump's return to the Oval Office.

(Image credit: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Florida working to end vaccine mandates
item.description: Florida lawmakers will vote whether to repeal a law that requires children to receive vaccines for polio, diphtheria, measles, and mumps before entering school.
item.content:encoded:
Florida lawmakers will vote whether to repeal a law that requires children to receive vaccines for polio, diphtheria, measles, and mumps before entering school.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Epstein survivors join with lawmakers in calling for full release of government files
item.description: Standing in front of the U.S. Capitol, a group of eight survivors shared emotional stories of abuse and demanded more transparency from Congress on the government's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
Standing in front of the U.S. Capitol, a group of eight survivors shared emotional stories of abuse and demanded more transparency from Congress on the government's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: President Trump floats deploying National Guard troops to New Orleans
item.description: President Trump said the White House is considering whether to deploy National Guard troops to Chicago or a place with a governor who would welcome them, like New Orleans.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the White House is considering whether to deploy National Guard troops to Chicago or a place with a governor who would welcome them, like New Orleans.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: In a brawl over right-wing TV, Newsmax sues Fox News
item.description: Right-wing TV news outlet Newsmax sued Fox News on antitrust grounds, alleging the conservative media powerhouse had illegally sought to suppress its smaller rival's growth in cable news.
item.content:encoded:
Right-wing TV news outlet Newsmax sued Fox News on antitrust grounds, alleging the conservative media powerhouse had illegally sought to suppress its smaller rival's growth in cable news.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Hurricane Katrina had a silver-lining for some: Post-traumatic growth
item.description: The mental health effects of Hurricane Katrina have been studied for more than a decade, and that research found that post-traumatic growth can co-exist with post-traumatic stress.
item.content:encoded:
The mental health effects of Hurricane Katrina have been studied for more than a decade, and that research found that post-traumatic growth can co-exist with post-traumatic stress.

(Image credit: Pham family)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: SNL announces 5 new cast members, including one from 'Please Don't Destroy'
item.description: Ben Marshall of "Please Don't Destroy" will join the cast alongside comedians Tommy Brennan, Jeremy Culhane, Kam Patterson and Veronika Slowikowska. Here's what to know about them.
item.content:encoded: Ben Marshall of "Please Don't Destroy" will join the cast alongside comedians Tommy Brennan, Jeremy Culhane, Kam Patterson and Veronika Slowikowska. Here's what to know about them.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: FAQ: More details emerge about the 76 Guatemalan children whose deportations were stopped by a federal judge
item.description: Attorneys for the children ask for a longer-term block, saying deportation would put them in danger and violate their rights.
item.content:encoded:
Attorneys for the children ask for a longer-term block, saying deportation would put them in danger and violate their rights.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith
